PostTitle: Best work experience in life, earn it !
Pros: Open to knowledge sharing and learning, encouragement for certifications on company expenditure, interaction with cross-cultural & cross-functional teams. A free environment to work and implement new ideas.
Cons: Not all bosses( Immediate managers)  are that good, so a quality of employee needs to be maintained.

PostTitle: Bizarre cult like organisation; if you are in to that kind of thing you'll have a great time, otherwise run, run away.
Pros: Smart colleagues; there's always money for everything; working on the biggest commercial problems in the world.
Cons: Politics; everyone is in their own silo; no skill or technology in use at Google is in use anywhere else, so leaving isn't easy.

PostTitle: Even though it's not for everyone but once in your career, work for Google if you can.
Pros:
- Technology
- Perks
- Peers
Cons:
- Lack of customer focus
- Too many people with strong opinions

PostTitle: A wonderful opportunity for a challenge
Pros: Working environment, peers, benefits
Cons: Very high expectations, high pressure

PostTitle: By far the best company to work for
Pros: Everything, values employees
Cons: Deciding what not to eat.

PostTitle: The best employer for a very long time
Pros: Smart people, great benefits and environment
Cons: Late/early night VC calls, a big corporate now

PostTitle: Great company to work for
Pros: Great culture and love flexibility
Cons: Keeping yourself up to date with industry to take advantage of competitive market

PostTitle: I basically have my dream job.
Pros: Great place to work that puts the worker first and allows a fair bit of autonomy and opportunities for excellence.
Cons: Google is a large company. It sometimes lacks charm of a smaller start-up environment or small business.

PostTitle: It was worth it and only company I've left i would think of returning to.
Pros: Telling friends you work for Google. It is a trusted brand and having this on my resume is a great talking point.
Cons: Google values diversity and you can sometimes be confused why someone is in a position or might be less experienced than you. Great culture though and you are encouraged to listen to everyone around you.

PostTitle: Working at google was the most challenging and stressful period of my life
Pros: Google shares as part of your package
Cons: Pressure and lack of support from management

PostTitle: Give it a try.
Pros: The perks are good. There's great talks, and lots of opportunity to learn. The technology is worth encountering during your career.
Cons: The Mountain View office dominates projects. The leadership is very removed from the troops on the ground, despite efforts to make it appear otherwise. There's even elitism *within* Google, in addition to the general elitism that a lot of Googlers display.

PostTitle: I probably wouldn’t go back.
Pros: You’re working for Google. Definitely helps with further employment elsewhere.
Cons: Moving up the ladder.

PostTitle: It was an incredible place to work that didn't suit me in the long term.
Pros: Free food, awesome office, working with the best and brightest
Cons: To get the most out of working there you have to dedicate your entire life to it. Working out of hours is required if you want to get ahead and move through the ranks.

PostTitle: Enriching
Pros: Career dev
Cons: Red tape

PostTitle: PostTitle
